bug.author: ajay340
bug.summary: Logging results to Weights & Biases. Couldn't load entity due to error: Can't connect to network to query entity from API key
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.15 Python version: 3.7.4 Operating System: Windows 10
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I updated the library and logged into wandb successfully through cli. I tried importing this snippet of code: <denchmark-code>from wandb.keras import WandbCallback wandb.init(project="my_project_name") </denchmark-code>
into my jupyter notebook and when I run all of my cells sequentially, I get this error: <denchmark-code>AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\meta.py in setup(self) 46 import __main__ ---> 47 self.data["program"] = __main__.__file__ 48 except (ImportError, AttributeError):
AttributeError: module '__main__' has no attribute '__file__'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
KeyError Traceback (most recent call last) in 1 import wandb 2 from wandb.keras import WandbCallback ----> 3 wandb.init(project="my_project_name")
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\__init__.py in init(job_type, dir, config, project, entity, reinit, tags, group, allow_val_change, resume, force, tensorboard, sync_tensorboard, monitor_gym, name, notes, id, magic, anonymous) 1068 allow_val_change = True 1069 if config or telemetry_updated: -> 1070 run.config._update(config, allow_val_change=allow_val_change, as_defaults=not allow_val_change) 1071 1072 # Access history to ensure resumed is set when resuming
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\wandb_config.py in _update(self, params, allow_val_change, as_defaults) 276 continue 277 self._items[key] = val --> 278 self.persist() 279 280 def update(self, params, allow_val_change=False):
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\wandb_config.py in persist(self) 194 conf_file.write(str(self)) 195 if wandb.run and wandb.run._jupyter_agent: --> 196 wandb.run._jupyter_agent.start() 197 198 def get(self, *args):
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\jupyter.py in start(self) 120 def start(self): 121 if self.paused: --> 122 self.rm = RunManager(wandb.run, output=False, cloud=wandb.run.mode != "dryrun") 123 wandb.run.api._file_stream_api = None 124 self.rm.mirror_stdout_stderr()
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\run_manager.py in __init__(self, run, project, tags, cloud, output, port) 504 # Calling .start() on _meta and _system_stats will spin a thread that reports system stats every 30 seconds 505 self._system_stats = stats.SystemStats(run, self._api) --> 506 self._meta = meta.Meta(self._api, self._run.dir) 507 self._meta.data["jobType"] = self._run.job_type 508 self._meta.data["mode"] = self._run.mode
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\meta.py in __init__(self, api, out_dir) 34 self.data = {} 35 self.lock = threading.Lock() ---> 36 self.setup() 37 self._thread = threading.Thread(target=self._thread_body) 38 self._thread.daemon = True
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\meta.py in setup(self) 52 self.data["program"] = os.getenv(env.NOTEBOOK_NAME) 53 else: ---> 54 meta = wandb.jupyter.notebook_metadata() 55 if meta.get("path"): 56 if "fileId=" in meta["path"]:
C:\Python37\lib\site-packages\wandb\jupyter.py in notebook_metadata() 108 if isinstance(nn, dict) and nn.get("kernel"): 109 if nn['kernel']['id'] == kernel_id: --> 110 return {"root": s['notebook_dir'], "path": nn['notebook']['path'], "name": nn['notebook']['name']} 111 return {} 112
KeyError: 'notebook' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>pip install --upgrade wandb wandb login <insert token>
import wandb from wandb.keras import WandbCallback wandb.init(project="my_project_name")
</denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.92. Please mark this comment with ğŸ‘ or ğŸ‘ to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Have the same problem have you found out what is causing it?

Have the same problem have you found out what is causing it?
A workaround I did was run the weights and biases in a normal python script and then run it again in the notebook and then it started working.

Have the same problem have you found out what is causing it?
Ì¶AÌ¶ Ì¶wÌ¶oÌ¶rÌ¶kÌ¶aÌ¶rÌ¶oÌ¶uÌ¶nÌ¶dÌ¶ Ì¶IÌ¶ Ì¶dÌ¶iÌ¶dÌ¶ Ì¶wÌ¶aÌ¶sÌ¶ Ì¶rÌ¶uÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶tÌ¶hÌ¶eÌ¶ Ì¶wÌ¶eÌ¶iÌ¶gÌ¶hÌ¶tÌ¶sÌ¶ Ì¶aÌ¶nÌ¶dÌ¶ Ì¶bÌ¶iÌ¶aÌ¶sÌ¶eÌ¶sÌ¶ Ì¶iÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶aÌ¶ Ì¶nÌ¶oÌ¶rÌ¶mÌ¶aÌ¶lÌ¶ Ì¶pÌ¶yÌ¶tÌ¶hÌ¶oÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶sÌ¶cÌ¶rÌ¶iÌ¶pÌ¶tÌ¶ Ì¶aÌ¶nÌ¶dÌ¶ Ì¶tÌ¶hÌ¶eÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶rÌ¶uÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶iÌ¶tÌ¶ Ì¶aÌ¶gÌ¶aÌ¶iÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶iÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶tÌ¶hÌ¶eÌ¶ Ì¶nÌ¶oÌ¶tÌ¶eÌ¶bÌ¶oÌ¶oÌ¶kÌ¶ Ì¶aÌ¶nÌ¶dÌ¶ Ì¶tÌ¶hÌ¶eÌ¶nÌ¶ Ì¶iÌ¶tÌ¶ Ì¶sÌ¶tÌ¶aÌ¶rÌ¶tÌ¶eÌ¶dÌ¶ Ì¶wÌ¶oÌ¶rÌ¶kÌ¶iÌ¶nÌ¶gÌ¶.Ì¶
Nevermind this workaround is no longer working.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajay340>@ajay340</denchmark-link> set enitity to your username when you call wandb.init

@ajay340 set enitity to your username when you call wandb.init
Thanks it started working when I set the entity in my wandb.init
Cool, weâ€™ll have a fix for the root cause in the next release!

Hi. Im still experiencing this issue with version 0.8.19. I'm not sure what is meant by:
set enitity to your username when you call wandb.init
Can you post an example? Thank you.

Nevermind my comment above. I sorted out that I need to do: wandb.init(project="project-name", entity="username") However, I'm still receiving: KeyError: 'notebook' It seems to work in an interactive python shell but it breaks in a Jupiter notebook
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jwanga>@jwanga</denchmark-link> can you share the full stacktrace for the KeyError you're seeing?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vanpelt>@vanpelt</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) /usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/meta.py in setup(self) 46 import __main__ ---> 47 self.data["program"] = __main__.__file__ 48 except (ImportError, AttributeError):
AttributeError: module '__main__' has no attribute '__file__'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
KeyError Traceback (most recent call last) in 3 get_ipython().system(' wandb login 12121212121212121212121212121212121') ----> 4 wandb.init(project="project-name", entity="username")
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py in init(job_type, dir, config, project, entity, reinit, tags, group, allow_val_change, resume, force, tensorboard, sync_tensorboard, monitor_gym, name, notes, id, magic, anonymous) 1084 allow_val_change = True 1085 if config or telemetry_updated: -> 1086 run.config._update(config, allow_val_change=allow_val_change, as_defaults=not allow_val_change) 1087 1088 # Access history to ensure resumed is set when resuming
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/wandb_config.py in _update(self, params, allow_val_change, as_defaults) 277 continue 278 self._items[key] = val --> 279 self.persist() 280 281 def update(self, params, allow_val_change=False):
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/wandb_config.py in persist(self) 195 conf_file.write(str(self)) 196 if wandb.run and wandb.run._jupyter_agent: --> 197 wandb.run._jupyter_agent.start() 198 199 def get(self, *args):
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/jupyter.py in start(self) 120 def start(self): 121 if self.paused: --> 122 self.rm = RunManager(wandb.run, output=False, cloud=wandb.run.mode != "dryrun") 123 wandb.run.api._file_stream_api = None 124 self.rm.mirror_stdout_stderr()
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/run_manager.py in __init__(self, run, project, tags, cloud, output, port) 504 # Calling .start() on _meta and _system_stats will spin a thread that reports system stats every 30 seconds 505 self._system_stats = stats.SystemStats(run, self._api) --> 506 self._meta = meta.Meta(self._api, self._run.dir) 507 self._meta.data["jobType"] = self._run.job_type 508 self._meta.data["mode"] = self._run.mode
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/meta.py in __init__(self, api, out_dir) 34 self.data = {} 35 self.lock = threading.Lock() ---> 36 self.setup() 37 self._thread = threading.Thread(target=self._thread_body) 38 self._thread.daemon = True
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/meta.py in setup(self) 52 self.data["program"] = os.getenv(env.NOTEBOOK_NAME) 53 else: ---> 54 meta = wandb.jupyter.notebook_metadata() 55 if meta.get("path"): 56 if "fileId=" in meta["path"]:
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/jupyter.py in notebook_metadata() 108 if isinstance(nn, dict) and nn.get("kernel"): 109 if nn['kernel']['id'] == kernel_id: --> 110 return {"root": s['notebook_dir'], "path": nn['notebook']['path'], "name": nn['notebook']['name']} 111 return {} 112
KeyError: 'notebook' </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vanpelt>@vanpelt</denchmark-link> created a PR to address the issue I was seeing. Its partially a bug in the Jupiter instance that ships with VSCode. So I added some code to handle it gracefully. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/pull/782>#782</denchmark-link>
Just wanted to update that my issue still persists despite that I have added the entity parameter in the wandb.init function.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajay340>@ajay340</denchmark-link> try upgrading to v0.8.22. It includes my PR that fixed the issue for me.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jwanga>@jwanga</denchmark-link> I have upgraded to 0.8.22 and the issue still persists.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajay340>@ajay340</denchmark-link> can you post your newest stack trace again?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jwanga>@jwanga</denchmark-link> Sorry about that. I had updated my wandb package but not jupyter. So I updated and restarted jupyter and now it is working.
